title: London motorbike death victim who was thrown 10ft down road by black cab while riding pillion pictured
text:
'SHE WAS BEAUTIFUL, KIND AND CARING' London motorbike death victim who was thrown 10ft down road by black cab while riding pillion pictured 
Claire Berretti, 45, was killed when her motorbike collided with the taxi in Farringdon, London By ELLIE FLYNN Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments THIS is the first picture of a hair salon manager who was thrown 10ft down the road and died in a horror motorbike crash. 
Claire Berretti, 45, was killed when the motorbike she was riding pillion on collided with a taxi in Farringdon, London. stian42@hotmail.com Claire Berretti, 45, was killed while riding pillion on a motorbike in London Eyevine 4 Claire died in the horror crash in Clerkenwell, north London last Tuesday 
Despite desperate efforts to save her from paramedics and passersby, she was sadly pronounced dead at the scene. 
Her family have spoken of their heartbreak on what would have been her 46th birthday today. 
Sister Gillian Berretti told the Evening Standard : “It is just so sad. She was such a generous soul. She was beautiful, kind and caring, a natural comedian too. Eyevine Another man who was riding the motorbike suffered injuries when they collided with a black cab 
“She was warm and generous and full of life.” 
Heartbroken Gillian said their dad was due to come to London for an “incredible” birthday weekend. 
She added: “Today is particularly difficult for him and us all because it is her birthday. He is absolutely devastated.” 
A man who was riding the motorbike at the time of the crash was also injured. 
One witness said he was “calling her name” as she lay dying. He added: “He clearly wasn’t processing what was happening.” 
The taxi driver stopped and was not arrested. A bouquet of flowers has been left at the scene of the tragic death on Clerkenwell Road, addressed to Claire’s family and friends. 
It reads: “Take comfort she did not suffer in pain. 
“Nothing will make this accident any less senseless, but I wanted you to know she didn’t die alone. Many people did everything they could to save her. 
“It was tragic and happened so quickly – but she was surrounded by people who tried and stayed.” Eyevine Claire’s family have paid an emotional tribute to their beloved sister and daughter on what would have been her 46th birthday 
Claire taught dance and aerobics in Ayr, Scotland, before moving down to London in her mid 20s. 
She worked at Richard Ward salon before working her way up to manager at London’s Sejour salon. 
Sejour is “Britain’s premier hair salon” and was launched by celeb hairdresser Shaun Hoffman. 
Detectives from the Serious Collision Investigation Unit are investigating. 
Anyone who witnessed the crash should call the Serious Collision Investigation Unit at Alperton on 020 8991 9555 or Crimestoppers anonymously on 0800 555 111.
